Reviews.Title: “Exactly as advertised”
Reviews.Author: Zachary B
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here during Carnivale in 2012, at which we had an absolute bast. The hotel is a 10 minute walk from the boat station on Lido, from which it is a 15 minute ride to St. Mark's square in Venice. The hotel also has a great location on Lido, near the shops and restaurants on one of the main streets on Lido, and also near a 10 minute walk to the beach on the other side of Lido (which was good for a stroll, if not for a swim, during our stay). The room's themselves were very clean, simple, and comfortable. The beds were large (180cm?), and firm, with memory foam mattresses. When we first arrived, Venice was very cold, around -4 or-5 C,and our room was also very cold. But everything warmed up over the course of our 6 night stay. There is a very pleasant breakfast room where one can revive themselves. The hotel is generous with their continental breakfast, and we had to remember to save our appetite for Venice! Last but not least, the staff were very friendly and helpful. We would definitely recommend the hotel to others!

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Malibured3
Reviews.Content: Hotel Villa Cipro is located on The Lido, a quick vaporetto ride from anywhere in Venice. The Lido is quite charming, showing another dimension of Venice. It is very tranquil This was my second trip to Venice and the second time I stayed on The Lido. The hotel was quite nice. The staff was friendly. Our room was perfect, with all the required amenities. The breakfast buffet was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous accomodation and location”
Reviews.Author: zara2
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as we wanted to be close to Venice but also needed somewhere we could put our car. This hotel offered free car parking. Having travelled around most of Italy over many years staying in budget and not so budget hotels, I have learned not to expect too much of Italian accommodation. However, I was pleasantly surprised when we arrived at Hotel Villa Cipro. The hotel was located in a lovely quiet location near the main street of Lido. The reception staff were very helpful and I found the rooms lovely, clean, with great beds and all the required amenities. The breakfast was also very good with a range of food to choose from at the buffet - the breakfast ladies provided excellent service. In comparison to many other breakfasts I have had in Italy, I thought this one was very good. The hotel has a lovely personality and I was surprised that it had so few stars. We chose this location and knew it would require travelling on the vaporetto to the centre of Venice, however, it was easy and no further than it would take to travel from the mainland to some other areas in Venice. I have stayed in Canneregio before but I felt this was a better location especially to visit places like, Murano, Burano and Torcello. I loved coming back to Lido at the end of a long day in the centre of Venice as it was so much less busy and more peaceful. I have been to Venice four times and have stayed in a variety of areas and I would highly recommend staying in Lido and especially at this hotel. As to comments in the other reviews in regards to the English level of the reception staff, I felt all the staff at the hotel spoke good English. After all we were in Italy and the fact that the Italians made an effort to speak our native language â€“ we should be very grateful, maybe we mono-lingual people need to make more of an effort to learn the languages of the countries we are visiting.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but hotel could make a few improvements”
Reviews.Author: smileycub
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with two friends for 3 nights in June. The location of the hotel is fantastic; a quiet area within easy access of the vaporetto and Lido. The staff were cordial but not over-friendly. Rooms were clean, but a little small and apart from a massively oversized light fitting, sparsely decorated. The aircon. was not particularly efficient; you need to leave it on all day whilst you are out to make it reasonably cool for when you return. Bathroom was small but functional, but the towels are made of curious thin material so take your own if you prefer the luxurious fluffy variety. Take a beach towel also or be prepared to buy one locally. Breakfast was quite basic, with low quality pastries and unappetising ham, cheese and fruit; not a great advert for Italian cuisine. However, on the bright side you can boil your own egg which is a change from the pre-cooked rock hard ones you often find in hotels. If you would like something yummy for breakfast there are various places nearby selling great coffee and fresh, delicious pastries. There are plenty of shops and restaurants just a stone's throw away, but we spent most of our time either in the heart of Venice or on Murano where we found great places to eat with the help of the Lonely Planet Guide Book. We did eat on the Lido on our final night and had an excellent meal with great service and a fabulous sunset view at The Viktoria Palace Hotel which is just by the Vaporetto stop 5 minuites walk from the hotel. So to sum up; great location but staff, breakfast and and decor at Villa Cipro could all do with a small injection of joy.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: JHelmsNaples
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, traveled with 2 dogs (1 small, and 1 medium sized) had no problems at all. One of the dogs barked some while we were gone and I think it might have disturbed other guests. The hotel staff was friendly about informing me of this and we took care of the problem. Great location, the island of Lido is nice. One small note to keep in mind if you are driving you will have to take the ferry across which is 19 euro for the vehicle. Breakfast was poor however since moving to Italy I can not recall many places with good breakfast. Also the A/C is rather poor, we had to buy a fan to maintain. Reasonably priced and great staff. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good but could be better”
Reviews.Author: suleimanova_ira
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose this hotel because the price was fine and the location was good. We highly appreciated the calm and peaceful atmosphere of this hotel. The island of Lido itself is also great, with nice beaches and everything else you need to enjoy your vacation. Just a minor disappointment - breakfasts were so poor.. The choice is very limited compared to most other hotels. The coffee was bad and what was supposed to be boiling water for tea was just slightly warm. Cleaning services need to be improved as well. But in general, if you're planning a cost-effective vacation and the hotel is only for a few hours of sleep, that's what you can choose. The staff is helpful and quite friendly.

Reviews.Title: “We would stay in Villa Cipro again”
Reviews.Author: BillPHastings
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the excellent waterbus service (is 33 euros of unlimited travel for 72 hours around Venice and the islands really expensive (and it even includes the bus service to and from the airport.)..?? we think not)... the Lido is THE place to stay (with the added advantage in the summer months of good sea bathing); Villa Cipro is well placed between the main shops and waterbus station and the beach, just a few minutes walk to both. Our room had two balconiesand was plenty big enough with mini fridge, a good bathroom and constant hot water. The breakfast was very good - an unlimited buffet...next time we shall be going by car to Venice so we can take the dog who can stay at Villa Cipro as well. In short due to the many awful reiews of Venice hotels we went with low expectations but Villa Cipro proved to be a great exception. One last thing. nothing to do with the hotel,...as usual lazy italian cooking, pasta or pizza, was very disappointing and pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, but beware the water bus costs.”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi_OE_09
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fine. Easy to get to from the water bus station. Good sized rooms with bathroom. No shower curtain for the shower so be careful of your stuff getting wet. They provide complimentary breakfast however its not really that nice. The island of Lido where this hotel is located is very nice. Its quiet and has some great little places to eat. The only real downside was the cost of the water bus which was around 6 euro per person per trip which bumped the cost of the hotel up a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for Venice travelers”
Reviews.Author: ucfe
Reviews.Content: If you are traveling to Venice, the best you can do is to stay in Lido to avoid the noice and crowds. This hotel is perfectly located in a quiet and beautiful area just about 2 blocks from the Vaporetto stop. In about 10 min or less you are in the heart of Venice, so this is a great option. The hotel Villa Cipro is very clean and the rooms are spacious. Every morning we opened our window and could feel the breeze and tranquility of Lido. They have this quiet garden juts outside where you can sit down and enjoy your morning coffee. The staff was very friendly and breakfast was good (however, don't expect coffee to be good!). You can also walk a few blocks and you are right on the beach (what a pleasant surprise!). If you are going to Venice, stay in Lido because is much more affordable but overall is away from hectic Venice. I will highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best you can get for this price”
Reviews.Author: koneslon
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Villa Cipro for 2 nights during our short trip to Venice. My wife booked the hotel by email and the price was 110EUR per night. Hotel is situated on Lido island, so we took direct Ali Laguna boat from the Venice Marco Polo airport (13EUR per person) and disembarked at Lido in 1 hour. We did not know where the hotel was exactly, but we asked the waiter in the street cafe and he was happy to help us. Hotel staff at reception did not speak English that good, but as we are also not native speakers, we did not expect much. Room was clean with two big windows, small ancient TV, closet and minibar. Bathroom was small, but clean and convenient to use. Bed seemed short to me, but wide enough for two people. Breakfast was simple, but again, everything we wanted to have we got: salami, cheese, bread, coffee, fruit, yoghurt etc. Wi-Fi internet was 5EUR per hour. You have to get the login and password from the receptionist. You can use internet for free from the computer in the lobby. I would definitely recommend this hotel to the ones who does not stay long time in the hotel, but who come to Venice for sightseeing as budget travellers. Also me being tired of chain hotels, I was happy to see relaxed faces of hotel staff. Though they don't wear uniforms and rubber smile on the faces, they do their job really good. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: alemas
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and me stayed at the hotel 3 nights in the beginning of December. We are satisfied with our choice. The place is near to beach, near to main street with restaurants and shops, nevertheless not on the busy part. The vaporett stop is about 5 minutes walk and then you are in about 10 minutes in the city centre. Vaporetts goes rather often. The hotel is clean and breakfast is really hearty and tasty. Our double room was nice, air-conditioning was OK, bathroom too. There were three different reception clerks with three different levels of English. There were only one problem last day. The receptionist wanted to pay for drunk bootles from refrigerator in our room in spite of we didn't drink them. But she was polite and we didn't pay it.

Reviews.Title: “Meh.”
Reviews.Author: Kris0218
Reviews.Content: This was my first time on the Island of Lido, and while I was taken with the Island itself, I was underwhelmed with the Hotel Villa Cipro. The location is great - just off a main Boardwalk - and it looks great from the outside. The inside, however, was rather shabby-looking. We got there in late spring, but the heat was still on and unable to be turned off. We had to sleep with our ground-level window open, which we weren't very comfortable with. The bathroom was cramped with plastic counters and a horrible shower. There was free internet access in the lobby, but on one slow, old computer. Also, the free breakfast was served from 8-10am. We got there at 9am and there were no pastries, rolls, juice or coffee left, and no new supplies came out. Just some sad-looking fruit and boxes of cereal with yogurt. We paid a hefty price for a very mediocre hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “beauty of the lido”
Reviews.Author: tbornottbLondon
Reviews.Content: Well, this is a great place to stay if you want to go to venice..... We found that living on the lido was the best best thing to do as it gives you a great overview of the heart of the beautiful venice. Its cheaper, quieter, and once you get on that vaporetti across the lagoon you have a great view of the city.... Take in a sunset as you get the boat over to the lido - it is breathtaking The hotel is clean, easy to find, simple to book and very straight forward - whilst not being expensive. The place is slightly set back from the main road of the Lido but lovely... you are near the great Rizzo shop and only a couple of minutes for a supermarket...... you can do cheap travel to venice if you want. Staff at the hotel good, breakfast simple but all in all good value

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, cosy and clean”
Reviews.Author: rangirover
Reviews.Content: My family of six took 2 rooms in Villa Cipro in July. My husband and I had a standard double and our 4 children shared a quad room. We stayed 4 nights. The hotel was immaculately clean and extremely convenient for shopping , going to the beach and taking a ferry to Venice. It had a lovely balcony at the entrance where guests could sit and relax. This is a 3 star hotel, so obviously there isn't a full restaurant, but there's a cosy dining room where a true continental breakfast is served - fruit and cereal,boiled eggs, cheese and meats and croissants, fruit juices, tea and coffee. It was perfectly adequate - even for my hungry children. The staff were all extremely helpful. Some spoke excellent English and some very little, and as my Italian is non existent communication was a little difficult at times, but not because of any lack of effort on their part. In the end we had everything we could want for a very conmfortable stay at a very reasonable price. I would definitely stay there again. It was a relief to get to the beach in the heat and the intimacy of the hotel was really pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “nice spot”
Reviews.Author: el_lodder
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Venice for the first time, and found that we had picked the right hotel at the right spot! After a long, hot and busy day in Venice centre, it is very nice to go 'home' to Venice Lido (only 8 minutes by vaporetto waterbus). The hotel was nice (nice building, quiet, in a green street, but still near shops and restaurants). The rooms were okay-sized, clean, well cooled by airco. We even had a roof terrass. Breakfast was not the best we ever had, but still fine. Don't expect any entertainment in the hotel: there isn't any. We sought a nice and quiet place to sleep at night, and we found it in hotel villa cipro. We will book this hotel again when we go back to Venice (and we will!).

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel service in Venice”
Reviews.Author: AKRFMunich
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Lido, Venice for a weekend in mid May 07. Our hotel was Hotel Villa Cipro in Lido. We had a bad experience and we want to share it with others and warn future travellers to Venice hotels. Our room air condition never worked despite the hotel reception informing us that it does. On our second night, we tried to use the air condition as it was quite hot and we informed the hotel reception the next morning. The hotel reception tried to convince us that the air condition was working fine, that the sign "snowflake" does not mean cool air, but it indicates that it's winter weather outside and "sunshine" sign means it's summer weather outside. So to get cool air, one must put it on the "sunshine" sign. This was of course ridiculous as we had travelled to so many countries and stayed at so many hotels and only this one gives the opposite meaning of the air condition. We left a message with the hotel reception for the owner to call us back, but the owner never did, and I had to call them up to find out if they will refund us for the second night or give us a discount to compensate us for our horrible hot room the second evening. The owner, not only didn't apologize (only much later on when I brought it up) but tried to convince us that we should have reported the problem right away even in the middle of the night. And since we only told them the problem the next morning upon checking out, there is nothing they could do. But she did tell me that the air condition in the room was broken on the second evening onwards and there was no engineer to fix it. Her only lame offer was to give us a Euro20 discount on the room. We paid Euro155 for each night and this measly discount was nothing. So to all the future travellers going to Venice or perhaps Italy, please remember that if you want your money back, you can forget about it, and if you want to change your room, you better do it the same moment you have a problem. Lastly, the owner even hung up the phone on me when I had called and I think in general, the hotel service is just very poor in Venice for too much money!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Venice”
Reviews.Author: queenslandtraveller
Reviews.Content: Dates of stay : Nov 4th - 7th, 2006(3 nights) End of the 7 - 8 week trip thru France and Italy. We selected the Hotel Cipro on Lido Island as we had heard Lido was a nice place to stay away from the tourists of Venice and it was easy to catch the water ferry to anywhere. Only issue we had was that as it was also end of holiday season a lot of accommodation and restaurants are closed for winter. Arrived at Venice station from Florence and caught water ferry to Lido Island. Ferry wharf right o/s rail station. Walked 800 metres straight down towards the beach and there is Villa Cipro. Location : Great location as away from main area of activity of bars and restaurants and in summer beach crowds but still only 5 minutes from them all. Located amongst private residences off main street.. Check In : Very good. English speaking lady who was extremely pleasant and helpful. Night staff at desk were also helpful. So for a total of 7 samll hotels in various size towns we had met with reception staff who spoke english. This was extremely good considering what we had read and been told prior to going there. Room : Great but typical european small. 2 Balconies and suspect during the summer holidays extremely nice to sit out there with a vino and watch the world go by. It was clean, well maintained, comfortable. The only issue w ehad and it appears it was due to the cold weather and all the windows staying shut was there was a smell towards the end of our stay from the bathroom(suspect toilet system) The old house was owned by a family and had been renovated into a comfortable 3 star hotel. Breakfast : Continental b/fast included. Lady(Anna) who looked after things at ground level was great and extremely helpful even with the language barrier. Transport : Water ferries available regularly. Hint : if arriving to stay for 3 days get a $E25.00 ferry pass as once validated it is valid for 72 hours from time of validation and we used ours constantly and to everywhere. Day passes are expensive I can assure you of that The 3 day pass is available at the railway station on arrival. Restaurants : Number of good restaurants available locally on island. 400 - 600 meteres away. Always remember that you are on a tourist island so things are touristy. Summary : Great little place to stay and convenientf or travel in Venice and around Lido island.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: pixie73
Reviews.Content: Charming building and good location for main restaurants and beach of lido. Greeted by very friendly staff. The room was absolutely minute, the bathroom and shower cubicle so small I couldn't turn round in it and I'm only 5'2! In general the room was fairly shabby. Our hairdryer had been ripped from the bathroom wall leaving a gaping hole when I requested another one this wasn't possible I would have to dry my hair in another room!!!The breakfast is a joke just a few cold boiled eggs, fruit and croissants no fresh coffee, no hot water for teas and no sight of any staff to help out..this hotel is definately NOT worthy of its 3star rating!!!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: jawsk
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in Venice at this hotel after a harrowing 2 days of travel. We were welcomed warmly by the man at the front desk even though it was after 12am. It was clean and in a lovely spot. The breakfast was wonderful and b/c of the hospitality of the people who worked there we had a great first time introduction to italy.

Reviews.Title: “awful service and hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Horrible experience!!! The woman at the front desk was extremely rude. She claimed to be the owner of the hotel and the only person working there. We had asked for some help with our luggage up the stairs and her response was that a 3 star hotel doesn't provide this service. The room she showed us was downstairs in a basement with no window (dungeon-like) and was not clean with a very dirty bedspread. It was so awful that we couldn't even bare to stay there and the woman was extremely rude and not helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a charming hotel, tastefully and elegantly decorated. Our room (302) was large with a lovely balcony. The fridge worked fine. There was a TV which had MTV, CNN and BBC World. The mattress was on the hard side and the pillows were rather too hard for my liking. The bathroom was small but had everything including bidet. The room and the hotel generally were very clean and well kept. The only complaint I had was that our in-room safe didn't work. The walls were very thin - sometimes we could hear a little too much of the amorous activities of the other guests. The reception staff were friendly and helpful but hampered by poor English. The bathrooms don't have shower curtains so be prepared for pools of water forming everywhere on the bathroom floor. Otherwise good plumbing, plentiful hot water. Breakfast was comprehensive (fruit, yoghurt, juices, coffee, milk, cereal, croissants, cheese, ham, crackers, soft cheese) but with no cooked food and the quality was a bit basic. The location of this hotel was great. Only 4-5 minutes walk eastwards on the S. Elisabetta road to the Lido vaporetto stop. There are plenty of shops, cafes/bars etc on this road so it's very convenient. Access to Venice itself is easy. About 10 minutes east by vaporetto (line 1) to San Marco. It was actually rather lovely to end the day with a boat trip back to the Lido. Also only 3 minutes walk to the Lido beach on the Western side of Lido (Adriatic Sea). If I were to return to Venice, I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT AREA, POOR HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the end of January in time for the Carnival. Had to ask directions to the hotel as discription was not very clear. At first glance we were pleased and the staff spoke quite good english. However when we checked in we were told that we had to take breakfasts in our room. This wouldn't have been a problem if the room hadn't been so small. After a second cramped breakfast where we were told that there was no choice of juices (just tomato ugh!), the toast was something brittle out of a packet, we encountered some italian guests returning to their rooms after enjoying their breakfast downstairs. When we tried to complain the staff's english suddenly wasn't so good! We told them on the first day that we wanted orange juice and we are still waiting! The Lido itself was a great location with some good restaurants and good access to Venice itself. However avoid this hotel, the rooms are small, the beds and pillows are hard and for us it spoilt some of the enjoyment that our Venice trip should have given us.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, picturesque location, very close to venice itself, very clean with polite and helpful staff. Overall, it was fantastic! I would undoubtable stay again! You definately won't want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My mom and I chose to stay at the Villa Cipro after narrowing down our choices from Tripadvisor ratings and sorting out our 3-night budget. We were extremely happy with our choice! It's a friendly, welcoming and quiet retreat of a hotel. The street that Villa Cipro is on is residential, and as it was Autumn, it had leaves on the ground - something you can only get on Lido due to the trees and proper streets. We were lucky with warm fall weather, and enjoyed our balcony off our twin room. The decor is very tasteful, and not outdated. We loved the two 'french doors' that open onto the balcony from two walls of the room! This certainly made the room feel bigger (and we saw that there are even bigger rooms available when peaking in from the hallway during the cleaning, but we were just fine with the size of ours). The breakfast is basic but enough to go on. There are enough choices of water-buses leaving from the ferry docks to get to San Marco, etc. The 10min journey is easy, and allows you to spend time in Venice and then return 'home' for dinner at one of the good restaurant choices on the main street (especially the one directly opposite the hotel that has an outdoor terrace - much better than any we went to in Venice, which were too expensive and touristy). I'd recommend this to anyone who doesn't mind a sense of adventure and easy-living on their trips.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was the best hotel ever. The hotel was so beautiful and the people are so friendly and helpful. Our room was nice sized and comfortable. Not far from anything. You can walk to the boats and takes about 7 min to venice by ferry. Stay here and you will never want to go home.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Villa Cipro
HotelInfo.Address: Via Zara, 2 | Lido, 30126 Venice, Italy
